data.title: Use HEAD to copy resources from Release_Windows folder
data.body:
Use HEAD to copy resources from Release_Windows folder
(instead of the master branch)

data.title: Support horizontal movement of the mouse wheel in the layout editor
data.body: Support horizontal movement of the mouse wheel in the layout editor.

data.title: Use std::size_t for indexes and sizes instead of unsigned int
data.body:
Use std::size_t for indexes and sizes instead of unsigned int (unsigned int is possibly lossy for storing sizes and indexes on 64 bits systems).

**Not really tested, however, it should not cause bugs as, for most cases (numbers < 2^32), the conversion between unsigned int and std::size_t is lossless.**

data.title: Code cleanup
GDevelop and C++ games now prefer the powerful discrete GPU
data.body:
GDevelop and C++ games now prefer the powerful discrete GPU on Optimus computers (Intel+Nvidia GPU) and on Switchable Graphics computers (Intel+AMD/ATI GPU).
(got this idea from a pull request in SFML repo. It may not be needed anymore because it will get integrated in SFML **2.4**).

data.title: Fix typo in some camera actions
data.body: Fix typo in some camera actions : "X" instead of "Y".

data.title: Parameter's default value is not taken into account if the parameter is not optional
data.body:
Parameter's default value is not taken into account if the parameter is not optional.
See http://forum.compilgames.net/viewtopic.php?p=52691#p52691

data.title: CodeCompiler is now "independant" from the GCC version on Windows
data.body:
Use the GCC macros to get the right include paths even if we compile GDevelop with another version than the 4.9.2.

(You can build GDevelop with TDM GCC 5.1.0 using this commit).

data.title: Update TDM-GCC to 5.1 (Windows)
data.body:
Since GCC 5.0, the C++ standard lib is fully C++11 compliant (with C++14 experimental support) with a new implementation of std::string allowing us to use const_iterators in erase/insert... as defined in the C++11 standard. However, the new C++11 ABI is not used on Fedora (and probably Ubuntu) even if the GCC version is 5.0/5.1/5.2.

http://tdm-gcc.tdragon.net/download

data.title: Fix search not working in the object editor
data.body:
The search text wasn't given to the ObjectListHelper object.
Fix #148.

data.title: Fix extra border condition of Destroy Outside Automatism
data.body:
Fix extra border condition of Destroy Outside Automatism. The manipulated type wasn't declared.
Fix #171.

data.title: Extra border condition (Destroy outside screen automatism) compilation error
data.body: Just add this condition and the compilation fails.

data.title: Fix compilation output not interpreted as UTF8
data.body: Fix compilation output not interpreted as UTF8. Also fix the blank lines in compilation output listview. Fix #168

data.title: Re-save all examples using the v4 version and fix some image problems
data.body: Re-save all examples using the v4 version and fix some image problems (some image were in indexed mode).

data.title: Fix bad encoding of compiler output in "Compilation tools" window
data.body: Seems that the output of the compiler is converted from ASCII, producing unknown characters.

data.title: Use point size (instead of pixel size) for events rendering
Empty external event sheet produce a linkage error if included by another one/a scene
data.body: Empty external event sheet produce a linkage error if included by another one/a scene.

data.title: [v4] Replace some indexing operators by iterators
data.body:
Replace some indexing operators by iterators in : 
- gd::SceneNameMangler
- gd::VariableParser
- gd::ExpressionParser::ValidSyntax only

I also added tests for the first two classes (to be sure this change doesn't cause problems).

data.title: Update v4 with master
data.body: Just update v4 with master and fix some merge conflicts.

data.title: Tilemap object missing translations
data.body:
The translations for this object were in a separate file which is not bundled anymore with GDevelop. I think we can include them in the main translation file of GDevelop.
By the way, the wxwidgets translations (useful for the default dialog buttons) must be included with GDevelop.

data.title: Compilation error with ReplaceScene()
data.body: It seems that this function doesn't exist, it's still named ChangeScene in RuntimeSceneTools.h.

data.title: TileMapObject memory consumption optimization
data.body:
In this PR, I changed some parts of the Tileset implementation. It now uses less memory and avoid crashing GDevelop when the amount of tiles is too high.

**The changes in detail :**
- the collidable property of **all** tiles is stored in a `std::vector<bool>` (the index is the tile id)
- only non-default hitboxes are stored inside a `std::map<int, TileHitbox>` (the tile id is the key)
- the tile texture coordinates (`TileTextureCoords`) are calculated on-demand (so the Tileset::Generate method was removed)
- because of these changes (and to take advantage of them), the `TileSet` class serialization format has changed : I introduced a `version` attribute to detect the old TileMapObject serialization format. It has the nice side effect to reduce the size of the gdg file.

_Now, the Tilemap object supports very big tilesets : tested with a 3000 \* 2000px tileset with 1 \* 1px tiles ! (GDevelop was crashing with the old version)_

**EDIT** : I just saw another possible memory problem : to avoid it, `TileSet::GetTileHitbox` now only returns by value (it avoids to create the hitbox in the cache if the tile has a default hitbox) and `TileSet::GetTileHitboxRef` has been created to get a non-const reference to the hitbox (if the hitbox doesn't exist in the cache, it is created). (see the difference between these two methods which were overloads before : 3321b71)

data.title: Use wxLaunchDefaultBrowser() in HelpProvider
data.body: Fix web browser not launching on Windows 10. Still need to be tested under other platforms.

data.title: New Text Object editor
data.body:
A brand new editor for the Text Object. It focuses on the text and is able to show a preview of the text (but without the custom font as wxWidgets can't load a font from file). It has the look&feel of a small text editor. I obviously used wxCrafter to create it.

![newtextobjecteditor](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/964512/8964277/eef4bc50-3624-11e5-96cd-84e0a8b21c13.png)

What do you think of this design ?

(Do not merge yet as it seems that Travis-CI doesn't build it because of some GD_IDE_ONLY files)
